modules.description: Provides DNS client operations including connection setup, message sending, and receiving, using protocol and address configurations. Works with types like `context`, `io_addr`, `stack`, and `t` to manage network interactions and asynchronous computations. Enables tasks such as resolving domain names, handling timeouts, and managing I/O resources efficiently.

Handles DNS client operations through context management, I/O address handling, and stack-based communication. Supports asynchronous message sending and receiving, with types like `context`, `io_addr`, `stack`, and `t` for network coordination. Enables domain name resolution, timeout control, and efficient I/O resource management. Examples include querying DNS servers, managing connection lifecycles, and processing responses in real-time.

Checks DNS records to validate email sources, including verifying the sender's IP address against SPF, DKIM, and DMARC policies. Operates on email headers, DNS query results, and IP address data. Used to authenticate incoming emails and prevent spoofing in mail server configurations.

Manages DNS client interactions via context, I/O address, and stack types, enabling asynchronous message handling and network coordination. Provides operations for domain resolution, timeout control, and real-time response processing. Supports querying DNS servers, managing connection lifecycles, and efficient I/O resource allocation. Examples include resolving domain names, handling DNS queries with custom timeouts, and maintaining persistent network connections.
